org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers

Class HostIdHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cdap.http.AbstractHttpHandler
      • org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers.AbstractRestDbHandler
        • org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers.HostIdHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.cdap.http.HttpHandler

    @Path(value="/v2/hosts//{id}")
public class HostIdHandler
extends AbstractRestDbHandler
    This is the AbstractRestDbHandler handling all requests made on the single host REST entry point.

      • getHost

        @GET
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void getHost(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                        io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                        @PathParam(value="id")
                        String id)
        Method called to retrieve a host entry from the database with the id in the request URI.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        id - the requested host's name

      • updateHost

        @PUT
@Consumes(value="application/json")
public void updateHost(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                           io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                           @PathParam(value="id")
                           String id)
        Method called to update the host entry with the given id. The entry is replaced by the one in the request's body.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        id - the requested host's name

      • options

        @OPTIONS
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void options(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                            io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                            @PathParam(value="id")
                            String id)
        Method called to get a list of all allowed HTTP methods on this entry point. The HTTP methods are sent as an array in the reply's headers.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        id - the requested host's name
